fr.sii.ogham.template.freemarker.builder

Class FreemarkerEmailBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.sii.ogham.core.fluent.AbstractParent<P>
      • fr.sii.ogham.template.freemarker.builder.AbstractFreemarkerBuilder<MYSELF,P>
        • fr.sii.ogham.template.freemarker.builder.AbstractFreemarkerMultiContentBuilder<FreemarkerEmailBuilder,EmailBuilder>
          • fr.sii.ogham.template.freemarker.builder.FreemarkerEmailBuilder
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Builder<TemplateParser>, ResourceResolutionBuilder<FreemarkerEmailBuilder>, DetectorBuilder<FreemarkerEmailBuilder>, VariantBuilder<FreemarkerEmailBuilder>, Parent<EmailBuilder>

    public class FreemarkerEmailBuilder
extends AbstractFreemarkerMultiContentBuilder<FreemarkerEmailBuilder,EmailBuilder>
    Configures parsing of templates using Freemarker. Specific resource resolution can be configured to use template prefix/suffix paths: 
     
 .classpath()
   .pathPrefix("email/")
   .pathSuffix(".html")
   .and()
 .file()
   .pathPrefix("/data/myapplication/templates/email")
   .pathSuffix(".html")
    You can customize default Freemarker Configuration: 
     
 .configuration()
   .version(Configuration.VERSION_2_3_25)
   .templateExceptionHandler(TemplateExceptionHandler.HTML_DEBUG_HANDLER)
    Or you can use a particular Freemarker Configuration: 
     
 .configuration(myConfiguration)
    Email protocol supports several contents (main and alternative). The main content is often an HTML email to display a beautiful email to users. The alternative content is often a textual fallback (when email client can't display HTML version like mobile phones that tries to display a summary of the email). You can configure which file extensions are supported by Freemarker to automatically load variants (HTML: main, TEXT: alternative): 
     
 .variant(EmailVariant.HTML, "html.ftl")
 .variant(EmailVariant.TEXT, "txt.ftl")
    Thanks to that configuration, you can send an email without specifying the extension: 
     
 service.send(new Email()
   .content(new MultiTemplateContent("email/sample", new SampleBean("foo", 42)))
   .to("foo.bar@sii.fr"))
    Ogham will then be able to detect which files exist and choose the right behavior:
    • If you provide an ".html" file (either in classpath or on filesytem), the HTML template is used as main content
    • If you provide an ".txt" file (either in classpath or on filesytem), the text template is used as main content
    • If you provide both files, the HTML template is used as main content and text template as alternative
    Author:
    Aur√©lien Baudet

    • Constructor Detail

      • FreemarkerEmailBuilder

        public FreemarkerEmailBuilder(EmailBuilder parent,
                              BuildContext buildContext)
        Initializes the builder with a parent builder. The parent builder is used when calling AbstractParent.and() method. The EnvironmentBuilder is used to evaluate properties when AbstractFreemarkerBuilder.build() method is called.
        Parameters:
        parent - the parent builder
        buildContext - for registering instances and property evaluation
